title: Baatein With Nukkadbaaz — Frontend (React + TS + Tailwind + shadcn/ui + React Query)

requirements.summary: Build public blog UI with clear navigation and core pages (Home, Posts listing, Post Details, About) in English, backed by backend post retrieval.
acceptanceCriteria: Top-level navigation links to Home, Posts, About.
Home page introduces “Baatein With Nukkadbaaz”, mentions Heena Mehta, and summarizes the theatre-news focus (workshops, stage shows, interviews, etc.).
Posts page shows a list/grid of posts with title, cover image, date, category, and excerpt.
Clicking a post opens a Post Details page with full content.
About page describes Heena Mehta (media/journalism experience) and the blog’s purpose.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell with route wiring for Home, Posts (listing), Post Details, and About, plus shared header/footer navigation. Use shadcn/ui composition patterns for layout primitives where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a responsive header with top-level navigation links to Home, Posts, About, and space for the blog logo. Use shadcn/ui components (e.g., Button) for consistent interactive styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a simple footer with English-only copy and optional lightweight links (e.g., back to top), aligned to the theatre-journalism theme.
Create Home page content introducing “Baatein With Nukkadbaaz”, mentioning Heena Mehta, and summarizing the theatre-news focus. Include a hero/banner image (wired in REQ-7).

Create Posts listing page that fetches posts via React Query and renders a list/grid of PostCard items with title, date, category, cover image, and excerpt (excerpt can be derived from content if not explicitly provided). Use shadcn/ui Card/Badge patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create Post Details page that fetches a single post by id from the backend and renders full content plus category and published date; style long-form content using Tailwind typography utilities.
Create About page describing Heena Mehta (media/journalism experience) and the blog mission for theatre enthusiasts; keep all user-facing text in English.

Create a reusable PostCard for the Posts grid/list, showing cover image, title, date, category badge, and excerpt, linking to Post Details. Use shadcn/ui Card/Badge/Button patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add React Query hooks for listing posts (newest first as provided by backend) and retrieving a single post; centralize query keys and basic error handling.
Ensure the app bootstraps correctly with the created App.tsx and global styles import; keep React Query and InternetIdentityProvider wiring intact.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent, basic-yet-attractive theatre journalism visual theme (warm stage-inspired palette, complementary typography), avoiding blue/purple dominance.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette (e.g., warm stage-inspired tones like maroon/cream/brass or similar) is used across backgrounds, headings, buttons, and links.
Typography pairing is consistent (distinct heading and body styles) and readable on mobile and desktop.
UI components (cards, buttons, nav) share consistent spacing, radius, and hover/focus states.

file_operations.description: Create the global stylesheet entry used by the app to define the theatre-inspired palette and typography foundations (CSS variables/Tailwind base layer), avoiding blue/purple-dominant tones; ensure readable defaults for body and headings.
Extend Tailwind theme tokens (e.g., custom semantic colors and font family tokens) to support the warm theatre journalism palette and consistent typography across components.
Apply consistent spacing, hover/focus styles, and typographic hierarchy in the header/navigation using Tailwind + shadcn/ui patterns. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Align card radius, spacing, and hover/focus states with the global theme and ensure visual consistency across the post list UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure long-form article styling (headings, links, lists, quotes) matches the site typography and color system using Tailwind typography utilities.

requirements.summary: Display theatre-relevant categories and enable filtering posts by category in the Posts UI; show category prominently on Post Details.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores a category value per post from a defined set (at least Workshops, Stage Shows, Interviews, Theatre News).
Posts list UI provides a category filter and shows only matching posts when selected.
Post Details clearly displays the post category.

file_operations.description: Add frontend helpers to map backend PostCategory values to user-friendly English labels (Workshops, Stage Shows, Interviews, Theatre News) and to associate each with a static icon reference (wired in REQ-7).
Add a React Query hook for category filtering that uses the backend capability to filter posts by category and integrates with query keys for caching and refetch.

Create a category filter control (e.g., Select/Tabs/Segmented control) for Workshops/Stage Shows/Interviews/Theatre News and an 'All' option; use shadcn/ui components for consistent UX. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire CategoryFilter into the Posts page so selecting a category updates the displayed posts (via React Query), and ensure each post card shows its category label/icon.
Ensure the Post Details header area displays the category label (and optional category icon) clearly and consistently with the theme.

requirements.summary: Provide an admin authoring UI for Heena Mehta: Internet Identity sign-in/out, admin-only create/edit/delete post controls, and an editor capturing title, category, cover image selection, excerpt, and markdown-like body; refresh UI via React Query invalidation.
acceptanceCriteria: A Sign In/Sign Out control is available for admin access via Internet Identity.
When signed out, admin actions (create/edit/delete) are not visible or are disabled.
When signed in as admin, an Admin area or controls allow creating, editing, and deleting posts.
Post editor captures title, category, cover image selection, excerpt, and body content.
Successful create/edit/delete immediately updates the UI (using React Query invalidation/refetch).

file_operations.description: Add a Sign In/Sign Out control using the existing Internet Identity hook, and clear React Query cache on logout as recommended by the authorization component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create React Query hooks to fetch admin status/role (e.g., isCallerAdmin/getCallerUserRole) and expose a simple boolean for gating admin UI; handle authorization errors gracefully.

Create an Admin page that is only accessible/visible when the current identity is an admin; show an access-denied state otherwise (without adding new auth providers). Use shadcn/ui composition patterns for page layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a post editor form capturing title, category, cover image selection (from static assets), excerpt, and markdown-like body text; include basic preview for body rendering. Use shadcn/ui Form-ish composition (Input/Textarea/Select/Button/Dialog) as available. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create an admin-only list/table of posts with Edit/Delete actions; use React Query for list data and mutations for delete/update. Use shadcn/ui components (e.g., Button, AlertDialog/Dialog) for confirmations. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add React Query mutations for create/update/delete post backend capabilities; on success, invalidate/refetch post list and any affected post detail queries to keep UI in sync.

Implement lightweight client-side persistence (e.g., localStorage) for optional UI-only fields not present in the backend interface (cover image choice and excerpt), keyed by post id, to support the editor fields and post card display without backend changes.
Wire LoginButton into the header and optionally show an Admin link when the user is authenticated and is an admin. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register routing to the Admin page and ensure navigation to it is not shown to non-admin users; keep public pages accessible without requiring login.
When current user is admin, show create/edit/delete entry points (e.g., a 'New Post' button and edit controls per post); hide or disable these controls when signed out or non-admin.
When current user is admin, show an Edit action (e.g., link to Admin editor for the post); hide/disable when not admin.

requirements.summary: Use relevant static images (logo, hero/banner, category icons, post cover placeholder) as frontend assets and display them in layout and post cards.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (not served via backend).
Home page includes a hero/banner image.
Site header includes a logo image.
Posts without a specific cover image use a theatre-appropriate placeholder cover image.

file_operations.description: Add generated static logo asset to be referenced by the frontend layout (header).
Add generated static hero/banner asset to be referenced by the Home page.
Add generated static category icons sprite asset to be referenced by category UI (filter and badges).
Add generated static post cover placeholder asset to be used when a post has no selected cover image.
Render the blog logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/baatein-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header branding area.
Render the hero/banner image from frontend/public/assets/generated/baatein-hero.dim_1600x600.png alongside the Home intro content.

Display a cover image on each post card: use the selected cover image (from UI-only storage) when present; otherwise fall back to frontend/public/assets/generated/baatein-post-placeholder.dim_1200x630.png.

Show category iconography derived from frontend/public/assets/generated/baatein-category-icons.dim_1024x256.png (e.g., using CSS background positioning or splitting logic) to visually reinforce filtering choices.
Wire category-to-icon mapping so Workshops/Stage Shows/Interviews/Theatre News can consistently display the correct icon from frontend/public/assets/generated/baatein-category-icons.dim_1024x256.png.
